abstract.text: An object that responds to remote command events.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The Media Player framework defines a standard set of remote command objects for handling media-related events. When an accessory or iOS user interface generates a remote control event, the system notifies the corresponding command object on the shared
instance. That command object executes any attached handlers.
To respond to a particular event, register a handler with the appropriate
Listing 1. Registering a remote control event handler

code: // Add a handler for the play command.
// Add a handler for the play command.

inlineContent.text: If you explicitly don’t want to enable a given command, fetch the command object and set its enabled property to
. Disabling a remote command lets the system know that it shouldn’t display any related UI for that command when your app is the Now Playing app.

The framework defines many subclasses to handle specific kinds of commands. Sometimes, these subclasses let you specify other information related to the command. For example, feedback commands let you specify a localized string that describes the meaning of the feedback. When supporting a particular command, be sure to look up the specific class used to handle those events.

abstract.text: A false value.
Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.
An object that responds to requests to change the current playback position of the playing item.
An object that responds to requests to change the playback rate of the playing item.
An object that responds to requests to change the current repeat mode used during playback.
An object that responds to requests to change the current shuffle mode used during playback.
An object that reflects the feedback state for the playing item.
An object that provides a detailed rating for the playing item.
An object that responds to remote command events.
Adds a target object to be called when an event is received.
Adds a block to be called when an event is received.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a user can interact with the displayed element.
Removes a target from the remote command object.
Removes a target and action from a remote command object.
An object that responds to remote control events sent by external accessories and system controls.
A description of a command sent by an external media player.
Constants indicating the status of a command.
An object that defines the skip intervals for the player.
Ensure your app is eligible to become the Now Playing app by adopting best practices for providing Now Playing info and registering for remote command center actions.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
